title: Huge fps drops after patch 7.7 (thread)
body:
u/madlife created a thread on EUW forum for all the players having fps issues after the latest patch, a lot of people is having this issue and the thread grew but  we got no answer from Riot.
Apparently after latest patch a lot of people both with low or high pc specs are getting massive fps drop after being a few minutes into a game. This issue can not be solved by changing graphics settings or doing what the official Riot Games support page for fps issues suggests. 

This is my personal experience: 

my specs:
intel i5 6660k @ 3.50 ghz
8gb ram
Nvidia gtx 960
Windows 10

it started yesterday (please note that even after the latest patch was released i played and lol and all was fine). My FPS went from 110 - 144 @ very high settings to 15 - 60 @ whatever graphics setting.
The only improvement comes from disabling V-sync (i increased my fps by around 20 - 30, but for a limited time)
The fps range has huge spikes, sometimes like 30-40 fps difference per second. Game litterally unplayable.
Also fps seems to be higher when the game starts, going down since minions spawn and reaching the minimum during teamfights later on in the game.

I tried other games to see if something in my pc was broken (ex: dark souls 3 @high settings | 45 - 60 fps, nothing changed since last time i played the game one week ago)
i also tried to do all the things Riot suggests on his support page and tried Hextech repair tool.

Still having issues. i hope some rioter explains what is going on.
If you guys are here for the same issue, please do a report of your experience.

EDIT: with the help from a Rioter in a ticket we solved my issue! My problem seemed to be that my cpu integrated graphics were processing the game instead of my GPU. here's how to solve it if you have a Nvidia graphic card.

- Right click on desktop and select Nvidia control panel
- Go to "manage 3d settings"
- On "global setting" click on "default graphic processor" and select "Nvidia high performance processor"
- Click on "apply"
- if you don't have the  "default graphic processor" entry you have to manually set lol.exe files (NOT THE CLIENT EXE, BUT THE ACTUAL GAME EXE) by going on the side menu "application settings" and by adding leagueoflegends.exe applications ( located on C:\Riot Games\League of Legends)

please note i translated the procedure from italian.

replies.body: This problem have existed since patch 7.1 and still there is not fix. you can find so many threads about this. Also, there is a russian Rioter who acknowledged the problem. however, so far there is no improvements.
read my edit on my post! i hope this will solve your issue.

And for AMD? It shows me only AMD Radeon Settings and then are the normal everlasting tabs. So any ideas? (old fps 130max-60min) (current 50max-15min). The thing is that i m playing rocket league or rainbowsix siege at a really good graphical settings and i dont have any fps issues. Only at League.

> [{quoted}](name=ParaSyte,realm=EUNE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=YjlIHUXA,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2017-04-11T12:30:05.241+0000)
>
> And for AMD? It shows me only AMD Radeon Settings and then are the normal everlasting tabs. So any ideas? (old fps 130max-60min) (current 50max-15min). The thing is that i m playing rocket league or rainbowsix siege at a really good graphical settings and i dont have any fps issues. Only at League.

Same here, I have AMD Radeon and dunno waht to do.

Yea I still have this problem where i get in game i get 50 to 60 fps and then it drops to 20s and lower. The drops happen after a few minutes. When i alt tab out and alt tab back in it gives me back the fps but It still drops after a few mins
You're not alone. Im having the exact same experience. When I play other games everything is smooth. Its just on League and its ever since the patch came out.

> if you don't have the "default graphic processor" entry you have to manually set lol.exe files (NOT THE CLIENT EXE, BUT THE ACTUAL GAME EXE) by going on the side menu "application settings" and by adding leagueoflegends.exe applications ( located on C:\Riot Games\League of Legends)

I donâ€žt know how to get this part done, little help please ?

I am also experiencing the same results after latest patch. The game is unplayable because its just a half second behind where it usually is. Nothing smooth about it. I lowered all my settings and made sure there was nothing running in the background. I even checked the new boxes to allow the client to be closed and such. Funny thing is, my parents have the same exact computer as me as we bought them at the same time. Mac Os x mid 2011. I opened on theirs and it was fine? like wtf? Rito plz.

honestly i had this feeling the game was half second behind specially in teamfights, but i wasn't sure about that. now that you said this and made me think yes, also this is probably happening and could be cause the FPS huge spikes i get in a small period of time

I want to make sure that your specific case might be an FPS issue, and not a network problem.  A delay like this could be caused by instability like packet loss too.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) for this game to get an overview and know for sure.  Let me know!
this is the screenshot of the log reader from my last game [link](http://prntscr.com/eu9ra7)

It's still happening, no response from riot as usual, just 'try this and that, because its probably your pc'.
Just admit that it's your shitty fucking spaghetti code of a game and fix that shit because this game used to run just fine.

https://support.serato.com/hc/en-us/articles/202305784-Changing-graphics-card-settings-to-use-your-dedicated-GPU-on-a-Windows-computer-

- This helped me :) - Your welcome!{{champion:164}}
Hi! I actually have the same problem but I have AMD Radeon and not Nvidia, what should I do?
and i have the same  problem after the game pass 35mn i get some weird fps droop WTF RIOT i have a very good pcand i cant run a moba game with 120hz stable ???????????????????

Oh man. I have same issue. I tried everything with RIOT support guy. He was really nice and he tried to do his best but even reinstalling Windows didn't help at the end. My computer is super old (Geforce 540M I5-2410m) but game was working fine (120-90 FPS) to patch  7,1, then it was bit slower (70-60FPS) but still ok. Then after 7.3 or 7.7 my problem was like yours, random drops after 10-20 min of game to 15 FPS. I had to leave LoL. It is sad because it was best MOBA for me. The good thing is that it's not my laptop but Riot patches messed up something.

I m the same like you guys :(
i've never ever have problem with my computer.

Frame drops can be pretty common as things change with updates, drivers, OS settings, the list goes on.   They can happen for a variety of reasons, so I usually ask that players go through each step of the FPS guide to help rule out possibilities.    While I haven't seen any widespread issues impacting FPS, it wouldn't hurt to take a deeper look and investigate further.  One of the reasons I appreciate these boards so much is because you help us discover emerging issues as soon as they happen, which helps us get to resolving them as soon as we can!

If you are having FPS issues and the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide didn't resolve it, then hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). If you do, make sure to download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), which will give us some more context through logs.

Our tech team can look into these reports, help individually, and track the issue.  Thanks for sharing your experience, and be sure to hit us up in a ticket!
we solved it through a ticket and i suggest to put this procedure on the FPS issue page on riot support, both for Nvidia and AMD gpu's
I know this is an old thread, but thank you so much! I was on the verge of just quitting league, till i found this thread and solved my problem! GG dude!
no offense bro but you know this is a problem for everyone who plays league, we all lost massive amounts of fps since a s7.

I sent out a ticket, hope it helps me resolve my issue. I have been having the problem every second patch since 7.1. It really infuriates me that it disappears just to come back next patch... And changing the graphics options makes no difference. According to my Nvidia Geforce experience I should be playing on very high, but I can barely get 30 fps on very low...

Same ever since I was forced to use the updated client I have been getting massive fps drops producing massive input lag in game. Everything has input lag,  moving around minions in lane is even a challenge now. On the legacy client the game ran like butter sucks that they forced this update  on us.
Same here with a 960..
yeah, i have the same thing. I am not sure how I can do that on AMD, and I was told that it only works on Intel processors. I have an AMD FX 8320. But i hope a Rioter can help us with that.

Same here, getting huge rubber band lag spikes+fp drops
i5 4760k 
16gb ram
1080 gtx
win 7
Same problem...
